verses.verse: (Prayer for Vindication and Vengeance) To the leader. Of David. A Psalm. (Ps 83.1) Do not be silent, O God of my praise.
For wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me, speaking against me with lying tongues.
(Ps 69.4) They surround me with words of hate and attack me without cause.
(Ps 38.20; 69.13) In return for my love they accuse me, even while I make prayer for them. (Syr: Heb I prayer)
(Ps 35.12; 38.20) So they reward me evil for good and hatred for my love.
(Zech 3.1) They say, (Heb lacks They say) “Appoint a wicked man against him; let an accuser stand on his right.
(Prov 28.9) When he is tried, let him be found guilty; let his prayer be counted as sin.
(Acts 1.20) May his days be few; may another seize his position.
(Ex 22.24) May his children be orphans and his wife a widow.
May his children wander about and beg; may they be driven out of (Gk: Heb may they seek) the ruins they inhabit.
(Job 5.5; 18.9) May the creditor seize all that he has; may strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
(Isa 9.17) May there be no one to do him a kindness nor anyone to pity his orphaned children.
(Ps 37.28; Prov 10.7) May his posterity be cut off; may his name be blotted out in the second generation.
(Ex 20.5; Neh 4.5; Jer 18.23) May the iniquity of his father (Cn: Heb fathers) be remembered before the LORD, and do not let the sin of his mother be blotted out.
(Ps 34.16) Let them be before the LORD continually, and may his (Gk: Heb their) memory be cut off from the earth.
(Ps 37.14, 32) For he did not remember to show kindness but pursued the poor and needy and the brokenhearted to their death.
(Prov 14.14; Ezek 35.6) He loved to curse; let curses come on him. He did not like blessing; may it be far from him.
(Num 5.22; Ps 73.6) He clothed himself with cursing as his coat; may it soak into his body like water, like oil into his bones.
May it be like a garment that he wraps around himself, like a belt that he wears every day.”
(Ps 71.10; 94.23; 2 Tim 4.14) May that be the reward of my accusers from the LORD, of those who speak evil against my life.
(Ps 69.16; 79.9) But you, O LORD my Lord, act on my behalf for your name’s sake; because your steadfast love is good, deliver me.
(Ps 40.17; 143.4) For I am poor and needy, and my heart is pierced within me.
(Ps 102.11) I am gone like a shadow at evening; I am shaken off like a locust.
(Heb 12.12) My knees are weak through fasting; my body has become gaunt.
(Ps 22.6, 7; Mt 27.39; Mk 15.29) I am an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.
Help me, O LORD my God! Save me according to your steadfast love.
(Job 37.7) Let them know that this is your hand; you, O LORD, have done it.
(2 Sam 16.11, 12; Isa 65.14) Let them curse, but you will bless. Let my assailants be put to shame; (Gk: Heb They have risen up and have been put to shame) may your servant be glad.
(Ps 35.26; 132.18) May my accusers be clothed with dishonor; may they be wrapped in their own shame as in a mantle.
(Ps 35.18) With my mouth I will give great thanks to the LORD; I will praise him in the midst of the throng.
(Ps 16.8; 121.5) For he stands at the right hand of the needy, to save them from those who would condemn them to death.
